result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Lambert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $25 per month commencing 07-01-2015 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 7 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay fine.  DNA surcharge is waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Lambert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Treatment Letter, received and filed in court by Atty. Morin.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James E Lambert in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $316
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 07/01/15 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 7 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James E Lambert in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.
File not called on the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James E Lambert in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  

Defense thinks there may be a new referral.
  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James E Lambert
Current: 2111 Kensington Drive Apt. #2, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 01-28-2015)
Prior: 450 Kimberly Dr #41, Waukesha, WI 53188

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint except for his own family members.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant James E Lambert in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
